DataElement.preferredName: Pre-existing Condition Acute Bacterial Infection Fungal Infection Registration Intravenous Route of Administration Antibiotic Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was the severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration associated with a bacterial infection, infections and associated diseases by bacteria, or fungal infection, infection caused by eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc, were present and required intravenous antibiotics, administration of a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms directly into a vein or veins, at the time of registration as an identified health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pre-existing Condition Acute Bacterial Infection Fungal Infection Registration Intravenous Route of Administration Antibiotic Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration associated with a bacterial infection, infections and associated diseases by bacteria, or fungal infection, infection caused by eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc, were present and required intravenous antibiotics, administration of a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms directly into a vein or veins, at the time of registration as an identified health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

Concepts.definition: A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

Property.preferredName: Acute Bacterial Infection Fungal Infection Registration Intravenous Route of Administration Antibiotic Present
Property.preferredDefinition: Having a severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration. (NCI):infections and associated diseases by bacteria, general or unspecified.:An infection caused by eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds).:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:Administration within or into a vein or veins.:(an-tih-by-AH-tik) A drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Having a severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration.
An acute infectious disorder that is caused by gram positive or gram negative bacteria; representative examples include pneumococcal, streptococcal, salmonella, and meningeal infections.
An infection caused by a fungus.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.

Substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans. Antibiotics kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms by targeting components of the microbial cell absent from human cells, including bacterial cell walls, cell membrane, and 30S or 50S ribosomal subunits. These substances are used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Acute bacterial or fungal inf
ReferenceDocuments.description: Acute bacterial or fungal infection requiring intravenous antibiotics at the time of registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Acute bacterial or fungal infection requiring intravenous antibiotics at the time of step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection requiring IV antibiotics within 2 weeks of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have an active infection requiring IV antibiotics within 2 weeks of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active and clinically significant bacterial, fungal, or viral infection at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection (excluding skin or toenail infections) requiring systemic antibiotic, antifungal or antiviral therapy within 28 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active infection requiring IV antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have ongoing active infection that is associated with symptoms and/or requires antibiotic therapy at the time of registration (excluding asymptomatic bacteriuria, genital herpes, oral herpes, thrush, bacterial vaginosis, vaginal candidiasis, topical antifungals)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection requiring IV antibiotics prior to registration?
